content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel are there, discussing the night before.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross kissed me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It was unbelievable!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, all right. We want to hear everything. Monica, get the wine and unplug the phone. Rachel, does this end well or do we need to get tissues?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it ended very well.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [getting the wine] Do not start without me. Do not start without me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, all right, let’s hear about the kiss. Was it like, was it like a soft brush against your lips? Or was it like a, you know, a “I gotta have you now” kind of thing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, at first it was really intense, you know. And then, oh, god, and then we just sort of sunk into it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, so, ok, was he holding you? Or was his hand like on your back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, actually first they started on my waist. And then, they slid up, and then, they were in my hair.
Phoebe/Monica: Ohhhh.

content.description: Ross’ apartment. Ross, Chandler, and Joey are there eating pizza.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And, uh, and then I kissed her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Tongue?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cool.

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk. Joey, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there; Chandler is showing everyone his new computer.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, check out this bad boy. 12 megabytes of ram. 500 megabyte hard drive. Built-in spreadsheet capabilities and a modem that transmits at over 28,000 b.p.s.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow. What are you gonna use it for?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [doggedly] Games and stuff.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [reading the paper] There are no jobs. There are no jobs for me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [reading over her shoulder] Wait, here’s one. Uh, would you be willing to cook naked?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s an ad for a naked chef?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, but if you’re willing to cook naked, then you might be willing to dance naked. And then… [rubs his fingers together]
[Ross enters, distraught.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, oh, so, um…how’d you make out last night?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That, that is funny. That is painfully funny. No, wait. Wait, yeah, that’s just painful

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute. I thought last night was great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it was, but…I get home, ok, and I see Julie’s saline solution on my night table. And I’m thinking to myself, oh my god, what the hell am I doing? I mean, here I am, I am with Julie, this incredible, great woman, who I care about and who cares about me, and I’m like, what, am I just gonna throw all that away?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got all that from saline solution?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We are talking about Rachel here. You and Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Believe me, I’ve been dreaming about me and Rachel for ten years now. But now, I’m with Julie, so it’s like me and Julie, me and Rachel, me and Julie, me and… [Rachel enters, carrying a tray]… Rachel. Rachel, Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [to Ross] Hey, you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How are you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good. How are you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good.
[Julie enters.]

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Hi, honey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, Julie. [nervous] Hi, Julie. Julie, um, how are you?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [uncomfortable] Good, so everybody’s here. Everybody’s good. So, were you gonna play something, Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well, actually.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [impatient] Play it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, all right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Julie, I didn’t know you wore lenses.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [to Joey] Ssshh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, um, hi, hello, hi, ok, so, um, this is a song about a love triangle between three people that I made up. Um, it’s called, um, “Two of Them Kissed Last Night”.
[Ross and Rachel look at each other and then at Phoebe, realizing the song is about their situation.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [singing] There was a girl, we’ll call her Betty, and a guy let’s call him Neil. Now I can’t stress this point too strongly, this story isn’t real. Now our Neil must decide, who will be the girl that he casts aside. Will Betty be the one who he loves truly? Or will it be the one who we’ll call Ju…Loolie? He must decide, he must decide, even though I made him up, he must decide!

content.description: Mr. Ratstatter’s office. Monica is there about a job.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: This is a nice resume. Nice, nice, nice. Muy impressivo.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, Mr. Rastatter, what exactly does this job entail? The ad wasn’t too clear.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Mockolate.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry?

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Mockolate. It’s a completely synthetic chocolate substitute.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh.
[He pulls out a piece of Mockolate.]

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Go ahead. Try a piece. Yeah, we think that Mockolate is even better than chocolate.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. Mmm-mmm.
[She tastes it, and obviously hates it.]

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [disgusted, trying not to show it] I love how it crumbles. Now see, your chocolate doesn’t do that.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: No, ma’am. Well, anyhoo, we should be getting our F.D.A. approval any day now, hopefully, in time for Thanksgiving. See, the way we look at it, chocolate already dominates most of your major food-preparation holidays: Easter, Christmas, what have you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [still chewing] Mmm-mmm.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: But, we’re thinking, given the right marketing, we can make Thanksgiving the Mockolate holiday.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Aren’t you going to swallow that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just waiting for it to stop bubbling.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Yeah, isn’t that great?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [with false enthusiasm] Mmm.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Well, anyhoo, um, we are looking for a couple of chefs who can create some Thanksgiving-themed recipes. You think you might be interested?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Abso…[swallows hard]…lutely. See, I love creating new recipes. I love Thanksgiving. And, well, now, I love Mockolate.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Especially the after taste, you know, I’ll tell ya, that’ll last ya till Christmas.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Phoebe are there. Monica is suggesting Mockolate recipes to Phoebe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How about Mockolate mousse?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not, it’s not very Thanksgiving-y.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, how about pilgrim Mockolate mousse?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What makes it pilgrim?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll put buckles on it.
[Rachel enters.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did uh, Ross call?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why didn’t he call? He’s gonna stay with Julie, isn’t he? He’s gonna stay with her and she’s going to be all, “Hi, I’m Julie, Ross picked me, and we’re gonna to get married, have a lot of kids and dig up stuff together.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No offense, but that sounds nothing like her.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Ross is up in arms about the Rachel/Julie situation.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know what to do. What am I gonna do? I mean, this, this is like a complete nightmare.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I know. This must be so hard. Oh, no. Two women love me. They’re both gorgeous and sexy. My wallet’s too small for my fifties, and my diamond shoes are too tight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, here’s a thought, Ross. [reaches for the computer]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t touch the computer. Don’t ever touch the computer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, listen. I got two words for you. Threesome.
[Ross gives him an insulted look.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, all right, look. Let’s get logical about this, ok? We’ll make a list. Rachel and Julie, pros and cons. Oh. We’ll put their names in bold, with different fonts, and I can use different colors for each column.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can’t we just use a pen?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, Amish boy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok, let’s start with the cons, ’cause they’re more fun. All right, Rachel first.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know. I mean, all right, I guess you can say she’s a little spoiled sometimes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You could say that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And I guess, you know, sometimes, she’s a little ditzy, you know. And I’ve seen her be a little too into her looks. Oh, and Julie and I, we have a lot in common ’cause we’re both paleontologists, but Rachel’s just a waitress.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Waitress. Got it. You guys wanna play Doom? Or we could keep doing this. What else?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, her ankles are a little chubby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, let’s do Julie. What’s wrong with her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [long pause] She’s not Rachel.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica has made food for Phoebe and Rachel to taste.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, this is pumpkin pie with mockolate cookie crumb crust. This is mockolate cranberry cake, and these are mockolate chip cookies. Just like the Indians served.
[Rachel takes a bite.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god good?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god, I can’t believe you let me put this in my mouth.
[Rachel runs to the sink to spit it out.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, oh sweet Lord! This is what evil must taste like!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler is on the phone with a computer hotline.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m telling you this thing won’t print. Yes, I pressed that button like 100 times. You know, for a hot line you are not so hot. What? What is that in the background? Are you watching Star Trek?
[Ross enters with a melancholy look.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [to Ross] Hey, so how’d it go with Julie? Did you, did you break her heart?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, it was horrible. She cried. I cried. She threw things, they hit me. Anyway, I did the right thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [in phone] So, Spock actually hugs his father?
[Rachel enters.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, do you guys have…[sees Ross, pauses]…hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [sees his coat on] Where you goin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I uh, I just got back from uh, from Julie’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [dejected] Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, uh, it’s not what you think. It’s um the other thing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what’s the other thing, what do I think?
[Joey is looking at Rachel, smiling, and gesturing his head towards Ross.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, uh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He broke up with Julie. Well, go hug her, for god’s sakes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really. It’s always been you, Rach.
[Ross and Rachel hug.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, god.
Joey/Chandler: Ohhh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, oh, this is good, this is really good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, I know, it’s, it’s almost…[turns around, sees Chandler and Joey] What do you say we go take a walk, just us, not them?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let me get my coat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok. No, hey, whoa, whoa, I’ll get your coat.
[Ross leaves.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, he’s goin’ to get my coat. He’s goin’ to get my coat. Oh my god, you guys. I can’t believe this. This is unbelievable. [notices Chandler’s computer screen] What’s that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [nervous] What? Nothing.
[Chandler closes up the laptop computer screen.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s that? What? I saw my name. What is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, see? See? [the printer starts to run] Hey, it’s printing. [to Joey, rattled] Hey, it’s printing!
[Chandler rips off the sheet of paper from the printer.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well what is it? Let me see.
[Ross walks back in, Rachel’s coat in hand.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, someone order a coat?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, Chandler wrote something about me on his computer and he won’t let me see.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He won’t? [remembers what it is] He won’t! Because, isn’t that, isn’t that the, the short story you were writing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes it is, short story, that I was writing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I’m in it? Then let me read it.
Chandler, Joey, Ross: No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, uh, why don’t you read it to her?
[Ross and Chandler stare angrily at Joey, who thinks he has come up with a good idea.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [through gritted teeth] Alright. [clears his throat] “It was summer, and it was hot. Rachel was there. A lonely gray couch. ‘Oh, look,’ cried Ned, and then the kingdom was his forever. The end.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s it? That’s all you wrote? You’re the worst writer in the whole world.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, you know what? This isn’t funny anymore. There’s something about me on that piece of paper and I want to see it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, you don’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, you know what, that’s fine. If you guys want to be children about this, that’s fine. I do not need to see it. [Rachel grabs the paper and runs across the room, reading it to herself.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is this? Ross, what is this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good luck.
[Chandler and Joey leave quickly.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, just, just remember how crazy I am about you, ok?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Kind of ditzy? Too into her looks? Spoiled?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now that’s a little spoiled. He was supposed to type “little”, the idiot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just a waitress?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, that, that was, I mean, as opposed to uh, the uh, ok. Is this over yet Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I do not have chubby ankles!
[Rachel leaves, and Ross follows her into the hall.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, wait, ok, ok, look at the other side. Look at Julie’s column.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She is not Rachem . What the hell’s a Rachem? Is that some stupid paleontology word that I wouldn’t know because I’m just a waitress.
[She goes into her apartment and slams the door.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, Rach, come on. Rach! Rach, no, no! She’s not Rachel, she is, she is not, Ra—Rachel?

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk. Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Phoebe are there.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My diary! My diary, that’s brilliant. I should have told her it was my diary, she never would have made me read her my diary.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, that’s true. You’d be a great person to have around the day after an emergency.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I… I cannot believe Ross even made this list. What a dinkus.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, cut him some slack. It was Chandler’s idea.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh good, I was hoping that would come up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This was your idea?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What were you thinking?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [squirming] All right, let’s get some perspective here, ok? These things, they happen for a reason.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. You!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, Pheebs, back me up here, ok? You believe in that karma crap, don’t you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, by the way, good luck in your next life as a dung beetle.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Rachel is sitting on the couch, eating candy. It is raining out. Ross climbs up the fire escape and is knocking on the window.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach! Whoops! Rach, hey, open up, please!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [coldly] When somebody does not buzz you in, Ross, that means go away. That doesn’t mean please climb up the fire escape.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just wanna read something. It’s your pro list.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not interested.
[Rachel closes the drapes over the window, goes into her bedroom and closes the door.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [reading his list] Ok, ok, number one: The way you cry at game shows. Number two: how much you love your friends. Number three: the way you play with your hair when you’re nervous. Number four: how brave you are for starting your life over. Number five: how great you are with Ben.
[Monica, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe enter, confused.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Number six: the way you smell.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [opens the drapes] Hey, Ross! What are you doin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Joey. You wanna open the window?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, I do.
[He opens the window, Ross comes in, soaked.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing out there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am, uh, I am…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you must be freezing. You know what you need? How about a nice steaming cup of hot Mockolate?
[Ross runs to Rachel’s bedroom, knocking on the door.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, come on, open up. Rach, come on, come on, Rach. You got to give me another chance.
[Rachel opens the door.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s what I said.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, maybe we should go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you guys, you really don’t have to go, we’re done talking.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, come on, look, I know how you must feel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [near tears] No, you don’t, Ross. Imagine the worst things you think about yourself. Now, how would you feel if the one person that you trusted the most in the world not only thinks them too, but actually uses them as reasons not to be with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, but, but I wanna be with you in spite of all those things.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, that’s, that’s mighty big of you, Ross. [to the others] I said don’t go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what? You know what? If, things were the other way around, there’s nothing you could put on a list that would ever make me not want to be with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, then, I guess that’s the difference between us. See, I’d never make a list.
[She closes the door in his face. Ross walks sullenly back to the couch and sits down. A moment of silence ensues.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [quietly] I never know how long you’re supposed to wait in this type of a situation before you can talk again, you know? [Ross stares blankly at him] Maybe a little longer.

content.description: Mr. Ratstatter’s office. Monica is there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now, in some of these recipes, the quantities may seem just a little unusual, uh, like these coconut mockolate holiday nut bars. I’ve indicated four cups of coconut, and four cups of crushed nut, and only, uh, one tablespoon of mockolate.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Doesn’t matter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Our FDA approval didn’t come through. Something about laboratory rats.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, gosh, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Yeah, well, anyhoo, here is your check. [hands it to her] Thank you for all the trouble you went through. Um, listen, you didn’t eat a lot of it while you were cooking, did you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, uh, I ate some.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Oh, some, that’s fine. Some is fine. Some is not a lot. So, it doesn’t burn when you pee, does it?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Rachel are there.

content.text: (phone rings)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello?
[Ross is at his apartment.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [to Monica] Is that him again? Tell him I’d come to the phone, but my ankles are weighin’ me down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [to Ross] Listen, I… I don’t think this is the best time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, can, can you do something for me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure, what? Ok, ok. [hangs up the phone] [to Rachel] Music?
[Monica turns on the radio.]

content.speaker: Radio
content.text: The next one’s dedicated to Rachel from Ross. Rachel, he wants you to know he’s deeply sorry for what he did and he hopes you can find it in your heart to forgive him. ( With or Without You plays)
[Rachel seems touched. She pauses for a moment, then picks up the phone and starts to dial. Cut to Ross at his apartment.]

content.speaker: Radio
content.text: Uh, we’ve just gotten a call from Rachel, and she told us what Ross did. It’s pretty appalling, and Ross, if you’re listening, I don’t wanna play your song anymore. Why don’t we devote our time to a couple that stands a chance? Avery, Michelle’s sorry she hit you with her car and she hopes you two will work it out.

content.description: Mr. Ratstatter’s office. Monica is there.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Hi, thanks for coming in again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, not at all. I have no morals and I need the cash.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: It’s like I’m lookin’ in a mirror. Anyway, they’re called “fishtachios”. They taste exactly like pistachios, but they’re made primarily of reconstituted fish bits. Here, try one. You’re not allergic to anything, are you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cat hair.

content.speaker: Mr. Ratstatter
content.text: Oh, sorry.
